授業目的: The purpose of this lecture is to study about official development assistance (ODA), particularly focusing on Japan: (i) its origin, evolution, and characteristics (ii) infrastructure-based cooperation, (iii) Infrastructure System Overseas Promotion Strategy, (iv) Impacts of China's Belt and Road Initiative on Japan's infrastructure-based cooperation.
到達目標:
(1) Students understand Japanese ODA deeply and systematically
(2) Students collect data from databases compiled by OECD, AidData, and UNCTAD
(3) Students formalize idea, write a paper, and make a presentation

第1回:
Introduction
・What do we study in this course?
(All lectures will be delivered in face-to-face format)
第2回:
Official development assistance (ODA)
・Definitions, characteristics and new trends
第3回:
Japanese ODA 1
・Origin, evolution, and characteristics
第4回:
Data exercises
・Using OECD Creditor Reporting System
第5回:
Japanese ODA 2
・Political conditionality and anti-Japanese sentiment
第6回:
Japanese ODA 3
・Tied aid
第7回:
Infrastructure exports 1
・Definitions, characteristics, and promotion policies
第8回:
Infrastructure exports 2
・Does "top-sale" by political leaders promote infrastructure exports?
第9回:
Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) 1 
・What is BRI, why did it emerge and what are benefits?
第10回:
BRI 2
・What are risks of the BRI?
第12回:
Aid-for-Trade (AfT)
・What is AfT, why did it emerge, is it effective?
第13回:
Data exercises
・Using UNCTAD data

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1
※kwicへのリンクとなります（在学生のみ閲覧可）
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Students are evaluated by accuracy, depth, and originality.
成績評価Grading2: 授業外学修課題／Assignment, homework required outside class (06)
Students are evaluated by accuracy for data exercise.
成績評価Grading3: プレゼンテーション・発表／Presentation (07)
Students are evaluated by clarity, depth of understanding, and oral presentation.

name: 【300】開発経済学／Development Economics
